medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent cardiac myxoma requiring fifth reoperative cardiac surgery.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has a history of cardiac myxomas since childhood, with major surgeries occurring in 1988, 1991, 2002, and 2008. A new intracardiac tumor was identified in August 2012 following unremarkable imaging that indicated no issues five months prior.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Carney complex, previous cardiac surgeries for myxoma, peripheral arterial embolism, occlusion of superficial femoral artery, hyperthyroidism, adenoma of the pituitary gland, recurrent mucosal tumors, spotty pigmentation, hirsutism, syndactyly of the toes, and kyphosis.
medical_history.family_history: The patient is the only individual in her family affected by clinical signs of Carney complex; genetic examination of her family has not been performed.
